guides.installOption1: Option-1. Use any of npm, pnpm, yarn to install it
guides.installOption2: Option-2. Just Copy, Create the file directly in your project and paste codes
guides.styleOption1: Option-1. Make Custom Styles below with below className
guides.recommandDaisyUI: The style of Gridsify applied in this guide and document is daisyUI, If not applied, please make your own style
guides.styleDescription1: The className of the root div in gridsify
guides.styleDescription2: The className of the gridsify-select element
guides.styleDescription3: The className of the wrap div tag for the table in gridsify
guides.styleDescription4: The className of the table tag in gridsify
guides.styleDescription5: The className of the checkbox element in gridsify
guides.styleDescription6: The className of the thead element in gridsify
guides.styleDescription7: The className of the tbody element in gridsify
guides.styleDescription8: The className of the pagination element in gridsify
guides.styleDescription9: The className applied to the currently selected sorting criterion in the thead after sorting
guides.styleDescription10: The className applied to the checked items in the tbody and the currently selected page in the pagination
guides.styleDescription11: The className for the border color of the secondary table head in gridsify
guides.styleNote2: Can be replaced with a custom element received via perPageOptions.el
guides.styleNote9: If daisyUI is not available, the color will not be applied during sorting as it is not a class provided by default in Tailwind, If you want to emphasize the sorting effect, please write styles either at the root-level or specific to the component
guides.styleNote10: If daisyUI is not available, the color for checked items will not be applied as it is not a class provided by default in Tailwind, If you want to emphasize the checked items effect, please write styles either at the root-level or specific to the component
guides.styleNote11: If daisyUI is not available, the color for th border items will not be applied as it is not a class provided by default in Tailwind, If you want to emphasize the th border effect, please write styles either at the root-level or specific to the component
guides.componentDescription2: Change icon when drag is available
guides.componentDescription3: Data to be handled in the table
guides.componentDescription4: Key-Value 2D Array for Mapping to Table Datas
guides.componentDescription7: Props in table tbody, thead tr
guides.componentDescription8: Props in table thead th tags for merge
guides.componentDescription11: Props for scrolling to the Y axis
guides.componentNote6:
className recive params data object, index

func is td onClick event function

el recive params data object,index and make custom el as you wish
guides.componentNote7:
className recive params data object, index (except thead)

func is td onClick event function

isDraggable is handle of tables draggables
guides.componentNote8:
colSpanStarter is an object with a merge start target and a title to assign to it

colSpanTarget is all of the merge targets for tracking
guides.componentNote10: table use this array values to perPageOptions.setPerpage
guides.componentDetail6: className, func, el // Takes (value, index, item) as common parameters
guides.checkableDescription1: The activation status of the prop
guides.checkableDescription3: Returns the selected 'no' values as an array
guides.tdOptionsDescription1: Assign a className to the specific cell
guides.tdOptionsDescription2: Assign a function to the specific cell
guides.tdOptionsDescription3: Add a custom element as a child to the specific cell
guides.tdOptionsNote1: If the function does not return a value, the specific cell will not be displayed properly
guides.requireAddedMapMatchKeys: It works properly only if addedMap matches the key
guides.trOptionsDescription1: Assign a className to the specific thead/tbody tr
guides.trOptionsDescription2: Assign a function to the specific thead/tbody tr
guides.trOptionsDescription3: The draggable status of the specific thead/tbody tr
guides.trOptionsDescription4: Returns the current page data array after the drag of the tbody tr is completed
guides.trOptionsDescription5: The function triggered when a tbody tr is double-clicked
guides.requireTbody: dragEndFunc and dbClickFunc can only be applied in the tbody
guides.trOptionsGuide1: Switch to non-draggable for the thead
guides.trOptionsGuide2: Switch to draggable for the thead
guides.trOptionsGuide3: Switch to non-draggable for the tbody
guides.trOptionsGuide4: Switch to draggable for the tbody
guides.disableTheadDraggable: When mergeTheadTrOptions is applied, the draggable option for the thead tr is disabled
guides.mergeTheadTrOptionsDescription1: Create an object with the key of the th where the merge starts
guides.mergeTheadTrOptionsDescription2: Create an array of all the keys included in the merge
guides.mergeTheadTrOptionsNote1:
title : The parent title of the merged th 
colSpan : The number of th elements to be merged
guides.perPageOptionsDescription4: Function to modify the number of data per page
guides.perPageOptionsNote1: If the pageLength is not provided, the pagination at the bottom will not work correctly
guides.perPageOptionsNote2: If using a custom element, you need to apply setPerPage within the element
